coref: A Peacock, puffed up with vanity, met a Crane one day, and to impress A Peacock spread A Peacock gorgeous tail in the Sun. Look, A Peacock said, What have you to compare with this? I am dressed in all the glory of the rainbow, while your feathers are gray as dust! a Crane spread a Crane broad wings and flew up toward the Sun. Follow me if you can, a Crane said, But A Peacock A Peacock stood where A Peacock was among the birds of the barnyard, while a Crane a Crane soared in freedom far up into the blue sky.
